artist: Artist: Nakabayashi Chikutō; Artist: Nukina Kaioku
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: five line inscription above a portrait of a kneeling man with wispy beard and hair, bearing a half smile, looking to PR; figure wears very lightly colored blue robe with white pants; robe and sleeves pool together toward bottom to form a triangular shape; three objects to PL of figure
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, and Seals

top half, in Japanese, see notes for translation
markings: when rolled, Japanese inscription at L; rectangular relief stamp at R; URC, rectangular relief; UL edge, two square intaglio; LLC, square intaglio: [Seisho no in]; LLC, square relief: [Chikuto jisaku]; when rolled, top of dowel, in pen: [Chikuto Tao Yuan-Ming]
signed:
LLC: {Chikuto Sanjin sha}

sign; 須静堂 on the top;竹洞山人 in the left bottom
title: Portrait of Tao Yuan-ming
